Uses of Class
gdi.game.dominion.Figure

Packages that use Figure
Package
Description
gdi.game.dominion
All classes supporting the Dominion game

  • Uses of Figure in gdi.game.dominion

    Methods in gdi.game.dominion that return Figure
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Figure
    DominionInterface.getNpc()
    Returns the Figure that is controlled by the computer and automatically walks to new target tiles.
    Figure
    DominionInterface.getPlayer()
    Returns the Figure that is controlled by the human player.
    Methods in gdi.game.dominion with parameters of type Figure
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    DominionInterface.chooseTarget(Figure figure)
    Automatically called by BaseGame.
    Searches for the closest DominionTile (based on the given Figure's current location) that is not yet property of the Figure and sends it there using moveTo(DominionTile).

    The closest tile can be determined measuring the euclidean distance of tiles' map coordinates.
    boolean
    DominionTile.isPropertyOf(Figure figure)
    Checks whether the passed Figure is the current owner of this DominionTile.
    void
    DominionInterface.reachedTarget(Figure figure, double time)
    Automatically called by BaseGame, when a Figure arrives at its target DominionTile.
    Declares the DominionTile property of the passed Figure.
    If the Figure is a non-playing character, it is given a new departure time that determines when the next DominionTile will be visited.
    void
    DominionTile.setOwner(Figure figure)
    Declares this DominionTile property of the passed Figure which is then the new owner of this tile.
    void
    BaseGame.setWinner(Figure figure)
    Stops the game and declares the player winner or loser.
